item.title: Betsey add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "She knew this music--knew it down to the very core of her being--but she had never heard it before. Unfamiliar, it had still always been there inside her, waiting to be woken. It grew from the core of mystery that gives a secret its special delight, religion its awe. It demanded to be accepted by simple faith, not dissected or questioned, and at the same time, it begged to be doubted and probed." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Tim McGraw
item.description: "Some say it's too country, some say it's too rock n' roll. But it's just good music if you can feel it in your soul." -- Tim McGraw

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Conway Twitty
item.description: "A good country song takes a page out of somebody's life and puts it to music." -- Conway Twitty

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Bob Newhart
item.description: "I don't like country music, but I don't mean to denigrate those who do. And for the people who like country music, denigrate means 'put down'." -- Bob Newhart

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Harlan Howard
item.description: "Country music is three chords and the truth." -- Harlan Howard

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Waylon Jennings w/ Lenny Kaye
item.description: "Waylon said it best when heï»¿ sang to Willy; 'If you see me gettin' smaller, I'm leavin' don't be grievin', just gotta get away from here. If you see me gettin' smaller, don't worry, I'm in no hurry I've got the right to disappear." -- Waylon Jennings w/ Lenny Kaye

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Chris Ledoux
item.description: "Sit tall in the saddle; hold your head up high. Keep your eyes fixed where the trail meets the sky, and live like you ain't afraid to die. And don't be scared, just enjoy your ride." -- Chris Ledoux

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Sometimes I lie awake at night and think about that little red-haired girl... I don't ever want to forget her face, but if I don't forget her face, I'll go crazy... How can I remember the face I can't forget? Suddenly I'm writing country western music!" -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Johnny Cash
item.description: "Everybody was wearing rhinestones, all those sparkly clothes, and cowboy boots. I decided to wear a black shirt and pants and see if I could get by with it. I did and I've worn black clothes ever since. " -- Johnny Cash

item.title: Betsey add a quote by CB Smith
item.description: "Love is a cowboy's hardest ride." -- CB Smith

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Autumn Cornwell
Betsey add a quote by Pam Houston
item.description: "Life gives us what we need when we need it; receiving what it gives us is a whole other thing." -- Pam Houston

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Cowboy Wisdom
item.description: "The best sermons are lived, not preached." -- Cowboy Wisdom

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Naomi Wolf
item.description: "For I conclude that the enemy is not lipstick, but guilt itself; that we deserve lipstick, if we want it, AND free speech; we deserve to be sexual AND serious--or whatever we please; we are entitled to wear cowboy boots to our own revolution." -- Naomi Wolf

item.title: Betsey add a quote by John Dunning
item.description: "What's that old cowboy saying? Never was a horse that couldn't be rode, never was a man who couldn't be throwed." -- John Dunning

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Poison
item.description: "Every rose has its thorn. Just like every night has its dawn. Just like every cowboy sings a sad, sad song. Every rose has it's thorn." -- Poison

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "Toby Keith writes songs like 1993's "Should've Been a Cowboy," and what's compelling is that you can't deconstruct its message. "Should've Been a Cowboy" is not like Bon Jovi's "Wanted Dead or Alive," where Jon Bon Jovi claimed to live like a cowboy; Toby Keith wants to be a cowboy for real." -- Chuck Klosterman

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "The cowboy music twanged in the roadhouse and carried across the fields, all sadness. It was all right with me. I kissed my baby and we put out the lights." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Caitlin Kittredge
item.description: "Word of advice, kid. This may be the Wild West down here, but you ain't a cowboy. You're not even a boy in a cowboy suit." -- Caitlin Kittredge

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Today you are You, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is Youer than You." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "Romance novels are birthday cake and life is often peanut butter and jelly. I think everyone should have lots of delicious romance novels lying around for those times when the peanut butter of life gets stuck to the roof of your mouth." -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: Betsey add a quote by paris hilton
item.description: "The way I see it, you should live everyday like its your birthday" -- paris hilton

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Jeanne Ray
item.description: "A slice of cake never made anyone fat. You don't eat the whole cake. You don't eat a cake every day of your life. You take the cake when it is offered because the cake is delicious. You have a slice of cake and what it reminds you of is someplace that's safe, uncomplicated, without stress. A cake is a party, a birthday, a wedding. A cake is what is served on the happiest days of your life." -- Jeanne Ray

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "Last week the candle factory burned down. Everyone just stood around and sang, 'Happy Birthday." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Robin Jones Gunn
item.description: "You know what I think? I think that if a young woman doesn't engage in the act of occasionally wishing on a star or a flower or a birthday cake full of candles, then we're forfeiting one of the sweetest whimsies of our youth." -- Robin Jones Gunn

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Lewis Carroll
Betsey add a quote by Bob Hope
item.description: "You know you're getting old when the candles cost more than the cake." -- Bob Hope

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Ian Dury
item.description: "All I want for my birthday is another birthday." -- Ian Dury

item.title: Betsey add a quote by Lorrie Moore
item.description: "I count too heavily on birthdays, though I know I shouldn't. Inevitably I begin to assess my life by them, figure out how I'm doing by how many people remember; it's like the old fantasy of attending your own funeral: You get to see who your friends are, get to see who shows up. " -- Lorrie Moore
